availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Gwin (Frankfort, Kentucky, merchant, councilman, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, merchant, councilman, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Julia A. Gwin. Father of Thomas J. Gwin and Kate L. Gwin. Delegate from Franklin County, Kentucky, to the Kentucky Whig Party Convention of 1848 in support of Zachary Taylor. Merchant in Frankfort in 1860. Member of the Frankfort City Council in 1865. Justice of the Peace in Franklin county from 1861 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 75; "Taylor Meeting in Franklin," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), January 21, 1848, p. 2; Find A Grave, "G. W. Gwin (1809-1881)," Memorial #74517922, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=74517922&ref=acom (accessed May 24, 2017); KYR-0001-005-0132; KYR-0001-019-0051; KYR-0001-004-0183.
